org.gvsig.geoprocess.lib.sextante

Class AbstractSextanteGeoProcess

  • java.lang.Object
    • es.unex.sextante.core.GeoAlgorithm
      • org.gvsig.geoprocess.lib.sextante.AbstractSextanteGeoProcess
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GeoProcess
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BufferAlgorithm, ClipAlgorithm, ConvexHullAlgorithm, ConvexHullAlgorithm, DifferenceAlgorithm, DispersePointsAlgorithm, DissolveAlgorithm, FuseSpatiallyAlgorithm, GroupByAlgorithm, gvGeoAlgorithm, IntersectionAlgorithm, LayerDatatypeSextanteAlgorithm, MergeAlgorithm, PointToLineAlgorithm, PrincipalComponentsSextanteAlgorithm, ReprojectAlgorithm, ROIMaskSextanteAlgorithm, SpatialJoinAlgorithm, SplitLinesAlgorithm, TasseledCapSextanteAlgorithm, UnionAlgorithm, XYShiftAlgorithm

    public abstract class AbstractSextanteGeoProcess
extends es.unex.sextante.core.GeoAlgorithm
implements GeoProcess
    Base implementation for Sextante based GeoProcess objects.

      • execute

        public boolean execute(es.unex.sextante.core.ITaskMonitor task,
                       es.unex.sextante.core.OutputFactory outputFactory,
                       java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> outputMap)
                throws es.unex.sextante.exceptions.GeoAlgorithmExecutionException
        Description copied from class: es.unex.sextante.core.GeoAlgorithm
        This method should be used to execute the algorithm once the parameters have been assigned.
        Overrides:
        execute in class es.unex.sextante.core.GeoAlgorithm
        Parameters:
        task - a ITaskMonitor to track the progress of the execution. If is null, a
        outputFactory - The output factory to use to generate new data objects
        outputMap - Maps IDataObject algorithm output names to the desired output name. At IDataObject output creation, OutputFactory implementations will receive the values in this map as names.
        Returns:
        true if the algorithm was correctly executed. False if it was canceled
        Throws:
        es.unex.sextante.exceptions.GeoAlgorithmExecutionException
        See Also:
        SilentTaskMonitor} will be used.

      • getNewRORasterLayer

        protected es.unex.sextante.dataObjects.IRasterLayer getNewRORasterLayer(java.lang.String sName,
                                                                        java.lang.String sDescription,
                                                                        int iDataType,
                                                                        int iBands)
                                                                 throws es.unex.sextante.exceptions.UnsupportedOutputChannelException
        This method creates a new raster layer and adds it to the set of output objects of the algorithm. Use this when your algorithm generates a new raster layer and you have to create it. The grid extent is taken from the algorithm analysis extent (@see GeoAlgorithm.getAnalysisExtent()
        Parameters:
        sName - The name of the layer. Has to be the same that you used to define this output in the
        sDescription - the long description of the output. This is the one usually used to describe the layer when added to a GIS GUI
        iDataType - The data type. See
        iBands - the number of bands of the new layer
        Returns:
        a new raster layer
        Throws:
        es.unex.sextante.exceptions.UnsupportedOutputChannelException
        See Also:
        #defineCharacteristics()} method., IRasterLayer} for more info about valid values
